IRANIAN 102A.description: Lecture, six hours. Requisite: course 1C or 20C. Course 102A is requisite to 102B, which is requisite to 102C. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 102A.title: Intermediate Persian

IRANIAN 102B.description: Lecture, six hours. Requisite: course 102A. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 102B.title: Intermediate Persian

IRANIAN 102C.description: Lecture, six hours. Requisite: course 102B. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 102C.title: Intermediate Persian

IRANIAN 103A.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 102C. Students who do exceptionally well in course 20C may be permitted to enroll with consent of instructor. May be taken independently for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 103A.title: Advanced Persian: Introduction to Classical Persian Poetry

IRANIAN 103B.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 102C. Students who do exceptionally well in course 20C may be permitted to enroll with consent of instructor. May be taken independently for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 103B.title: Advanced Persian: Introduction to Classical Persian Prose

IRANIAN 103C.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 102C. Students who do exceptionally well in course 20C may be permitted to enroll with consent of instructor. May be taken independently for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 103C.title: Advanced Persian: Introduction to Contemporary Persian Poetry and Prose

IRANIAN 104.description: Lecture, three hours. Readings in English. Introduction to wide selection of philosophical texts in translation. Identification of major philosophical themes in ontology, epistemology, psychology, and cosmology through texts, with study in detail. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 104.title: Philosophical Texts

IRANIAN 120.description: Lecture, two hours; discussion, one hour. Preparation: knowledge of Persian. Lectures in Persian, readings in English and Persian. Comparative study of six major Persian poets from 10th to 14th century who shaped sense of Persian identity and delineated chief distinguishing characteristics of Persian thought and culture. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 120.title: Comparative Study of Six Major Persian Poets

IRANIAN 130.description: Lecture, three hours. Readings in English. Introduction to intellectual history of Jews in Persia by highlighting select areas of Judeo-Persian studies and focusing on various authors and their work. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 130.title: Intellectual History of Jews of Persia

IRANIAN 131.description: Lecture, three hours. Preparation: knowledge of Persian equivalent to course 102C. Introduction to history of Judeo-Persian literature and culture to prepare students to read Judeo-Persian texts. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 131.title: Introduction to Judeo-Persian: Literature and Culture

IRANIAN 132.description: Lecture, three hours. Enforced requisites: courses 102C, 131. Literary study of Judeo-Persian literature, as segment of Iranian classical literature. Judeo-Persian literary genres, in forms of prose and verse, compared with their parallel genres in context of Iranian literature. Textual study of Judeo-Persian manuscripts, both print and cursive, and their variations depending on time period or locality. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 132.title: Intermediate Judeo-Persian Literature and Culture

IRANIAN 140.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 102C. Study of major Persian poets and prose writers: prose -- Sohravardi, Hamadâni, Nasafi, Irâqi, and others; poetry -- Hâfez, Sa'di, Rûmi, Bahâr, Dehkhoda, and others. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 140.title: Persian Belles Lettres (Adabiyyat)

IRANIAN 141.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 102C. Study of selected analytical and expository prose texts, with emphasis on philosophy, sciences, literary criticism, and history. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 141.title: Persian Analytical Prose

IRANIAN 142.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 102C. Study of major Persian works on popular ethics that have helped shape normative social, cultural, and political values in Iranian civilization. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 142.title: Persian Popular Ethics

IRANIAN 150A.description: Lecture, three hours. Knowledge of Persian not required. May be taken independently for credit.
IRANIAN 150A.title: Survey of Persian Literature in English

IRANIAN 150B.description: Lecture, three hours. Knowledge of Persian not required. May be taken independently for credit.
IRANIAN 150B.title: Survey of Persian Literature in English

IRANIAN 161A.description: Lecture, three hours. Preparation: knowledge of Persian desirable. Course 161A is requisite to 161B, which is requisite to 161C. Studies in grammars and texts of Middle Iranian languages (e.g., Middle Persian, Parthian, Sogdian, Khotanese, Bactrian). May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 161A.title: Elementary Middle Iranian

IRANIAN 161B.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 161A. Studies in grammars and texts of Middle Iranian languages (e.g., Middle Persian, Parthian, Sogdian, Khotanese, Bactrian). May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 161B.title: Elementary Middle Iranian

IRANIAN 161C.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 161B. Studies in grammars and texts of Middle Iranian languages (e.g., Middle Persian, Parthian, Sogdian, Khotanese, Bactrian). May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 161C.title: Elementary Middle Iranian

IRANIAN 169.description: Survey of Iranian culture from the beginning through Sasanian period.
IRANIAN 169.title: Civilization of Pre-Islamic Iran

IRANIAN 170.description: History of religion in Iran from the beginning to the Mohammedan conquest; Indo-Iranian background, Zoroastrianism, Manichaeism, Mazdakism.
IRANIAN 170.title: Religion in Ancient Iran

IRANIAN 187.description: Lecture, three hours. Variable topics; consult "Schedule of Classes" for topics to be offered in specific term. May be repeated for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 187.title: Variable Topics in Iranian Studies

IRANIAN 188FL.description: Seminar, two hours. Requisite: course 102C. Students must be concurrently enrolled in affiliated main course. Primary readings and advanced training in Iranian. Additional work in Iranian to enrich and augment work assigned in main course, including reading, writing, and other exercises in Iranian. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 188FL.title: Special Studies: Readings in Iranian

IRANIAN 189.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 189.title: Advanced Honors Seminars

IRANIAN 189HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
IRANIAN 189HC.title: Honors Contracts

IRANIAN 19.description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.
IRANIAN 19.title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars

IRANIAN 197.description: Tutorial, one hour. Limited to juniors/seniors. Individual intensive study, with scheduled meetings to be arranged between faculty member and student. Assigned reading and tangible evidence of mastery of subject matter required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 197.title: Individual Studies in Iranian

IRANIAN 199.description: Tutorial, one hour. Limited to juniors/seniors. Supervised individual research or investigation under guidance of faculty mentor. Culminating paper or project required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 199.title: Directed Research or Senior Project in Iranian

IRANIAN 1A.description: Lecture, six hours. Course 1A is enforced requisite to 1B, which is enforced requisite to 1C. Not open to students with prior knowledge of Persian. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 1A.title: Elementary Persian

IRANIAN 1B.description: Lecture, six hours. Enforced requisite: course 1A. Not open to students with prior knowledge of Persian. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 1B.title: Elementary Persian

IRANIAN 1C.description: Lecture, six hours. Enforced requisite: course 1B. Not open to students with prior knowledge of Persian. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 1C.title: Elementary Persian

IRANIAN 20A.description: Lecture, four hours; discussion two hours; laboratory, 30 minutes per day. Preparation: some knowledge of spoken Persian. Course 20A is enforced requisite to 20B, which is enforced requisite to 20C. Intensive and thorough study of fundamental structure of Persian grammar; reading from a wide range of classical and modern poetry and prose compositions. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 20A.title: Accelerated Elementary Persian

IRANIAN 20B.description: Lecture, four hours; discussion two hours; laboratory, 30 minutes per day. Preparation: some knowledge of spoken Persian. Enforced requisite: course 20A. Intensive and thorough study of fundamental structure of Persian grammar; reading from a wide range of classical and modern poetry and prose compositions. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 20B.title: Accelerated Elementary Persian

IRANIAN 20C.description: Lecture, four hours; discussion two hours; laboratory, 30 minutes per day. Preparation: some knowledge of spoken Persian. Enforced requisite: course 20B. Intensive and thorough study of fundamental structure of Persian grammar; reading from a wide range of classical and modern poetry and prose compositions. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 20C.title: Accelerated Elementary Persian

IRANIAN 220A.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisites: courses 103A, 103B, 103C. Study of selected classical Persian texts. May be taken independently for credit.
IRANIAN 220A.title: Classical Persian Texts

IRANIAN 220B.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisites: courses 103A, 103B, 103C. Study of selected classical Persian texts. May be taken independently for credit.
IRANIAN 220B.title: Classical Persian Texts

IRANIAN 221.description: Seminar, three hours. Requisite: course 220A or 220B. Study of life and works of Rumi in context of interaction of Sufism and poetic creativity. May be repeated twice for credit.
IRANIAN 221.title: Rumi, Mystic Poet of Islam

IRANIAN 231A.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 161C. Course 231A is requisite to 231B, which is requisite to 231C. Further studies in grammars and texts of Middle Iranian languages (e.g., Middle Persian, Parthian, Sogdian, Khotanese, Bactrian). May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN 231A.title: Advanced Middle Iranian

IRANIAN 231B.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 231A. Further studies in grammars and texts of Middle Iranian languages (e.g., Middle Persian, Parthian, Sogdian, Khotanese, Bactrian). May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN 231B.title: Advanced Middle Iranian

IRANIAN 231C.description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 231B. Further studies in grammars and texts of Middle Iranian languages (e.g., Middle Persian, Parthian, Sogdian, Khotanese, Bactrian). May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN 231C.title: Advanced Middle Iranian

IRANIAN 250.description: Seminar, three hours. Requisites: courses 103A, 103B, 103C, 199. May be repeated twice for credit.
IRANIAN 250.title: Seminar: Classcial Persian Literature

IRANIAN 251.description: Seminar, three hours. Requisite: course 140. Studies in specific problems and trends in Persian poetry and prose in the 20th century. May be repeated twice for credit.
IRANIAN 251.title: Seminar: Contemporary Persian Literature

IRANIAN 596.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. May be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN 596.title: Directed Individual Study

IRANIAN 597.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.
IRANIAN 597.title: Examination Preparation

IRANIAN 599.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. S/U grading.
IRANIAN 599.title: Ph.D

IRANIAN 8.description: Lecture, 10 hours; discussion, 10 hours. Not open to students who have learned, from whatever source, enough Persian to qualify for more advanced courses. Intensive course equivalent to courses 1A, 1B, and 1C. Introduction to fundamentals of Persian, including pronunciation, grammar, and Persian script, with emphasis on all four basic language skills -- speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing. Offered in summer only. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 8.title: Elementary Persian: Intensive

IRANIAN 89.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN 89.title: Honors Seminars

IRANIAN 89HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
IRANIAN 89HC.title: Honors Contracts

IRANIAN 99.description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.
IRANIAN 99.title: Student Research Program

IRANIAN CM163.description: (Same as Ancient Near East CM163.) Lecture, three hours. Designed to introduce students to Iranian archaeology from prehistoric through Achaemenid times. Concurrently scheduled with course CM259. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN CM163.title: Archaeology of Iran

IRANIAN CM259.description: (Same as Ancient Near East CM259.) Lecture, three hours. Designed to introduce students to Iranian archaeology from prehistoric through Achaemenid times. Concurrently scheduled with course CM163. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN CM259.title: Archaeology of Iran

IRANIAN M105A.description: (Same as Religion M105A.) Lecture, three hours. Readings in English. Rise and development of Babi and Baha'i religions in context of 19th century Iran. Focus on personalities of Bab, Baha'u'llah, and 'Abdu'l-baha. May be taken independently for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M105A.title: Baha'i Faith in Iran: Historical and Sociological Survey

IRANIAN M105B.description: (Same as Religion M105B.) Lecture, three hours. Readings in English. Analysis of major writings by Bab, Baha'u'llah, and 'Abdu'l-Baha. Emphasis on mystical and social principles. May be taken independently for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M105B.title: Baha'i Faith in Iran: Survey of Baha'i Scriptures and Thought

IRANIAN M105C.description: (Same as Religion M105C.) Lecture, three hours. Readings in English. Focus on history of 20th-century Iran beginning with constitutional revolution, development and persecution of Baha'i community, and latter's relation to reform movements in Iran. May be taken independently for credit. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M105C.title: Baha'i Faith in Iran: 20th Century Iran and the Baha'is

IRANIAN M110A.description: (Same as Ancient Near East M110A and History M110A.) Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour (when scheduled). From end of Elam and rise of Medes to Macedonian conquest of Achaemenid Persia. Emphasis on political history, state structure, empire's religions, and Greco-Persian interactions. Further accents on Cyrus' empire and Darius' world order, age of Persian Wars, Cyrus the Younger, Achaemenid Egypt, Alexander's conquest. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M110A.title: Iranian Civilization: History of Achaemenid Empire

IRANIAN M110B.description: (Same as Ancient Near East M110B and History M110B.) Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour (when scheduled). From Hellenistic rule in Persia to Sasanian conquest. Emphasis on political history, state structure, empire's religions, interactions with Hellenistic and Roman worlds. Further accent on Parthian conquest of Iran and Mesopotamia, Seleucid demise and Arsacid hegemony in East, Arsacid-Roman wars, rise of Sasanians. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M110B.title: Iranian Civilization: History of Arsacid (Parthian) Empire

IRANIAN M110C.description: (Same as Ancient Near East M110C and History M110C.) Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour (when scheduled). From fall of Arsacids to Muslim conquest of Iran. Emphasis on political and economic history, evolution of state structure, empire's religious landscape (Mazdism, Manicheism, Exilarchate, Church of Persia, Mazdakism), Persian and Roman/Byzantine interactions, Persia and East. Further accent on Persian-Roman conflicts and cooperation, Persia and Huns. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M110C.title: Iranian Civilization: History of Early Sasanian Empire -- From Ardashir I to Rise of Peroz (circa 224-459 C.E.)

IRANIAN M115A.description: (Same as Turkic Languages M115A.) Lecture, five hours. Knowledge of Russian, Turkish, and Iranian helpful. Grammatical competence at elementary level; knowledge of basic facts of Azeri grammar; reading competence with help of dictionary; ability to write simple compositions; basic conversational skill. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M115A.title: Elementary Azeri

IRANIAN M115B.description: (Same as Turkic Languages M115B.) Lecture, five hours. Knowledge of Russian, Turkish, and Iranian helpful. Grammatical competence at elementary level; knowledge of basic facts of Azeri grammar; reading competence with help of dictionary; ability to write simple compositions; basic conversational skill. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M115B.title: Elementary Azeri

IRANIAN M115C.description: (Same as Turkic Languages M115C.) Lecture, five hours. Knowledge of Russian, Turkish, and Iranian helpful. Grammatical competence at elementary level; knowledge of basic facts of Azeri grammar; reading competence with help of dictionary; ability to write simple compositions; basic conversational skill. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M115C.title: Elementary Azeri

IRANIAN M178.description: (Same as History M178 and Jewish Studies M178.) Lecture, three hours. Introduction to political, intellectual, cultural, and socioeconomic status of Iranian Jews. Exploration of history of Iranian Jews from ancient period throughout history, with focus on post-Middle Ages to present time. Topics, studied from perspective of Iranian cultural and intellectual history, include identity and status, religious tolerance versus forced conversion, Iranian Jewish emancipation, and dynamic symbiosis between Iranian Jews and other Iranians. P/NP or letter grading.
IRANIAN M178.title: Introduction to History and Culture of Iranian Jews

IRANIAN M210.description: (Same as Ancient Near East M208 and History M210.) Seminar, three hours. Varying topics on Elamite, Achaemenid, Arsacid, and Sasanian history. May be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN M210.title: Topics in Ancient Iranian History

IRANIAN M222A.description: (Same as Indo-European Studies M222A and South Asian M222A.) Lecture, three hours. Preparation: knowledge of Sanskrit equivalent to South Asian 110C. Characteristics of Vedic dialect and readings in Rig-Vedic hymns. May not be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN M222A.title: Vedic

IRANIAN M222B.description: (Same as Indo-European Studies M222B and South Asian M222B.) Lecture, three hours. Preparation: knowledge of Sanskrit equivalent to South Asian 110C. Characteristics of Vedic dialect and readings in Rig-Vedic hymns. May be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN M222B.title: Vedic

IRANIAN M230A.description: (Same as Indo-European Studies M230A.) Lecture, four hours. Studies in grammars and texts of Old Persian and Avestan. Comparative considerations. May not be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN M230A.title: Old Iranian

IRANIAN M230B.description: (Same as Indo-European Studies M230B.) Lecture, four hours. Studies in grammars and texts of Old Persian and Avestan. Comparative considerations. May be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
IRANIAN M230B.title: Old Iranian
